# Preface

Like so many textbooks, this one is born out of teaching experience. 

At the moment "textbook" is a bit aspirational. The book is really the collection of a bunch of flipbooks developed ad-hoc for teaching. Making them logically and logistically hang together is a work in progress.  

Also, much of the material doesn't have a lot of context or discussion, because these *flipbooks* were originally only focused on communicating *how to get things done*; I'd *explain concepts* in class in separate materials.  But, I hope to be enhancing the flipbooks to provide more context and discussion alongside the coding pipelines that now dominates the books.  

Please feel free to be in touch with suggestions on how to improve the "R Flipbook Textbook".
